{"pk": 5, "path": "0001000100010001", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "Vision and Mission", "draft_title": "Vision and Mission", "slug": "vision-and-mission", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/about/vision-and-mission/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "Vision and Mission", "body": "

2016 LAUNCH YEAR VISION

Our\u00a0vision\u00a0is of a\u00a0Durham For All!

  • an alternative economic development model for how Durham is run, in contrast to self-interested developers and corporations
  • a practice of participatory democracy that demands equity and confronts two separate, unequal Durhams which only serve a privileged few


We envision a Durham that:

  • grows through inclusion
  • confronts disparity and demands equity
  • governs based on progressive principles of racial, economic, and environmental justice
  • is rooted in working class people of color communities
  • focuses on our local level while being grounded in a systemic analysis that responds to changing conditions at all levels
  • creates replicable city-scale projects that can impact and shift the balance of power at the state and national levels

2016 LAUNCH YEAR MISSION

Durham For All's mission is to develop and maintain a political vehicle rooted in and led by working class people of color that builds political power to win. To accomplish this, we will:

  • use neighborhood, place-based organizing
  • engage in both electoral politics and issue-based campaigns
  • explore solidarity economies, people's assemblies, and creative engagement
  • develop and implement a broad progressive agenda, vision, and narrative for how Durham should be organized, in opposition to corporate & development power
  • unite and cohere an array of multi-racial, progressive political forces in Durham so that we can collectively win!

"}

{"pk": 6, "path": "000100010003", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Who We Are", "draft_title": "Who We Are", "slug": "who_we_are", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/who_we_are/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "Who We Are", "body": "

Durham For All launched in early 2016, but before then our founding team engaged in different issue-based organizing across Durham over the years. In 2014 and 2015, members of our founding team began experimenting with building political power through local elections, and we helped win young, progressive, people of color into local offices.

Durham For All is made up of a four-person Coordinating Team to bottom-line daily operations and a larger Campaign Team that is leading our\u00a010K Strong Campaign! Our core leadership is primary people of color, and our entire team is a multiracial, cross-class alliance of Durham organizers and activists with a range of skill-sets and progressive movement experience.

Durham For All is an independent political organization, and a 501(c)(4).

"}

{"pk": 7, "path": "000100010004", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "2016 Efforts", "draft_title": "2016 Efforts", "slug": "2016-efforts", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/2016-efforts/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "2016 Efforts", "body": "

NEIGHBORHOOD STABILIZATION ADVOCACY CAMPAIGN

(Early-Mid 2016)

As a result of the recent home revaluations, the average increase in home property values across Durham County is around 12%. But in Black & Brown working class neighborhoods that are rapidly gentrifying, there is a potential for property taxes to double or more than triple by 2017. In order to shift resources to working class residents, Durham For All:

  • Knocked on hundreds of doors to educate Northeast Central Durham (NECD) residents on the impact of the Property Tax Revaluation and availability of existing tax relief resources for homeowners
  • Worked with residents and city officials to advocate for a revamp of Durham's minor home repairs program as a way to provide tax relief for homeowners and to protect the cost of housing for renters

BASE BUILDING & RELATIONSHIP BUILDING

(Mid-Late 2016)

In the summer, Durham For All formed a team to lead base building in Durham's Precinct 14 in NECD. We have:

  • Continued to knock on hundreds of more doors, talking with folks in English and Spanish to learn about the issues they care about most, share our vision of political power, and invite them to get involved
  • Connected with leaders and groups in NECD
  • Held various community conversations about political power building with community members
  • Hosted a September Block Party next to East Durham Park, where hundreds came out to party and learn about Durham For All
  • Partnered with\u00a0BYP 100 Durham\u00a0in late October to lead a March to the Polls event from East Durham Park
  • Participated in the first Assembly of Latino Organizations in NC with Latin@ community members we met through door knocking

LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT

Throughout 2016, we are investing deeply in leadership development by:

  • expanding our team and participating in a collective study & practice process with new members
  • sending some of our team to a two-part, 8-day leadership course called\u00a0Transformation in Action by Generative Somatics\u00a0and a three-day alternative economies conference in Buffalo, New York, called\u00a0CommonBound
  • building the leadership of Black & Brown residents in working class neighborhoods through trainings and shared practice in:
    • door knocking
    • event mobilization
    • public speaking
    • relationship building, and more!

"}

{"pk": 8, "path": "000100010005", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "DURHAM FOR ALL: 10K STRONG", "draft_title": "DURHAM FOR ALL: 10K STRONG", "slug": "10k_strong", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/10k_strong/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "10k Strong", "body": "

Haga clic aqu\u00ed para la versi\u00f3n en espa\u00f1ol.

Below is the\u00a010K Strong Pledge, written by Durham For All, with the support of a range of progressive community leaders across Durham.\u00a0

\u00a0

Click \"Join Us!\" to sign the pledge and become a part of the 10K Strong campaign!\u00a0RSVP on Facebook for our 10K Strong Block Party & GOTV Action on September 23rd. More details to come!


OUR PURPOSE

It\u2019s time to win back our government and put it to work for all of us. Corporations and right-wing politicians have rigged the political system, and we\u2019ve had enough. Together, we are building a cross-class, multiracial movement in Durham that is 10,000 people strong.

This rigged system only works when the majority of people aren\u2019t taking action together. When democratic participation is small and people are divided, the wealthy and powerful win. To be successful, our movement needs to be massive and stand up for all of us. Our goal is to bring 10,000 people into action, because 10,000 is the number of people we need to elect or un-elect local elected officials. With 10,000 people, we can create a new, powerful majority in Durham. 10,000 people gives us a mandate for change.

When this new majority unites at the ballot box and in the streets, we will defeat the politics of division and greed. Together, we will address our biggest problems \u2014 the need for affordable homes, quality education, good jobs, and real safety. Together, we will elect people that will use our tax dollars to meet each person\u2019s basic needs and fight for a Durham where everyone can thrive. Together, we will demand that our local, state, and federal representatives serve all of our interests, not just the interests of the wealthy and powerful.

OUR PRINCIPLES

Our movement is guided by our deepest beliefs and a vision of the future we\u2019re building together:

HOMES FOR ALL

Everyone has the right to live in a safe and affordable home. Right now in Durham, decent homes are a privilege of the wealthy rather than a right for all. We know that the rents are too high and that landlords have too much power over our lives. We know that many people \u2014 especially Black and Brown people, low-income people, and disabled people are being forced out of their homes and their neighborhoods. This makes it hard to build community and a stable life. We demand policies that support permanent affordable housing as well as food, clean energy, clean water, and internet that everyone can afford.

EDUCATION FOR ALL

Everyone has the right to a high-quality public education that fully develops their potential. This includes poor children, children of color, immigrant and refugee children, and children with disabilities. However, the reality is that our public schools are segregated and deeply unequal. Education has become more focused on test scores than supporting our children\u2019s growth. Our schools don\u2019t have the resources they need, and it is our kids who suffer. We oppose cutting the arts, physical education, recess, and services for children with special needs. We demand well-funded public schools that educate whole people from preschool to college/trade school and help children develop into happy, healthy and thriving adults.

ECONOMY FOR ALL

Everyone has the right to the resources they need to sustain themselves and their families and to live on a healthy planet. Big corporations make a lot of money in Durham, but many keep workers in poverty-wage jobs, harm the environment, and don\u2019t pay their fair share of taxes. Our elders, disabled people, and people with criminal records are often left out of the economy. We need more access to safe, green, living-wage jobs with good benefits for our community to thrive. We want policies that spread wealth more equally by raising wages, creating job opportunities, and keeping money in our community. We want the right to organize unions and fight together for dignity and safety at work.

SANCTUARY FOR ALL

Everyone deserves to feel safe and secure in their bodies, homes, and communities. Too many people in Durham live in fear of violence at the hands of law enforcement. Too many live in fear of laws and politicians who promote hate and discrimination. Too many live in fear of violence in their homes or neighborhoods. We want an end to police violence, surveillance of Muslims, ICE raids, and policies that harm women and LGBTQ people. We call for policies that promote real community safety by divesting from criminalization and mass incarceration and investing in jobs, housing, healthcare, education, and community-based justice solutions outside of the police & prison system.

DEMOCRACY FOR ALL

Durham belongs to all who live here: Native, refugee and migrant, Black, Brown, Latino/a, Muslim, white, and Jewish, documented and undocumented, and LGBTQ. We need all these voices at the table to create a Durham for All. Right-wing politicians in North Carolina have used voter suppression to limit whose voice counts, turned hate into law, and made policies that benefit only the wealthy. We must end this attack on the people of North Carolina, and Durham must be a leader in a revolution for real democracy in our state.

OUR PLAN

Power comes from thousands of people speaking up and deciding to take action. That\u2019s why our plan is based on building people power from the ground up. The plan has three stages:

Stage 1: Build a Mandate (2017). We will train 100+ people to ask their family, friends, neighbors, and co-workers to sign our pledge and join the movement for a Durham for All. Our goal is to get 5,000 pledges in 2017. These signatures will be a mandate for a new political vision of the city rooted in the principles of a Durham for All. We will use these principles to elect a progressive majority to Durham\u2019s City Council and hold them accountable.

Stage 2: Build a Model (2018). In the second stage, we will engage residents in a series of public forums. Our goal is to dive deeper into each issue, create a set of policy demands, and reach 10,000 pledges. We will hold neighborhood meetings, people\u2019s assemblies, demonstrations, and other events to build support for our platform and take our demands to the streets. We will also train new leaders to expand the movement. Our focus will be on leaders who are working people, people of color, and women.

Stage 3: Build a Movement (2019-2020). In the third stage, we will pass the policies outlined in the platform. We will also bring fresh ideas, skilled leaders, and thousands of voters into the critical state and federal elections in 2020. Working with groups in rural areas, towns, and other cities, we will be part of unleashing millions of engaged residents and leaders in a movement to win back North Carolina.

Click \"Join Us!\" to sign the pledge and become a part of the 10K Strong campaign!\u00a0RSVP on Facebook for our 10K Strong Block Party & GOTV Action on September 23rd. More details to come!

"}

Everyone has the right to the resources they need to sustain themselves and their families and to live on a healthy planet. Big corporations make a lot of money in Durham, but many keep workers in poverty-wage jobs, harm the environment, and don\u2019t pay their fair share of taxes. Our elders, disabled people, and people with criminal records are often left out of the economy. We need more access to safe, green, living-wage jobs with good benefits for our community to thrive. We want policies that spread wealth more equally by raising wages, creating job opportunities, and keeping money in our community. We want the right to organize unions and fight together for dignity and safety at work.

SANCTUARY FOR ALL

Everyone deserves to feel safe and secure in their bodies, homes, and communities. Too many people in Durham live in fear of violence at the hands of law enforcement. Too many live in fear of laws and politicians who promote hate and discrimination. Too many live in fear of violence in their homes or neighborhoods. We want an end to police violence, surveillance of Muslims, ICE raids, and policies that harm women and LGBTQ people. We call for policies that promote real community safety by divesting from criminalization and mass incarceration and investing in jobs, housing, healthcare, education, and community-based justice solutions outside of the police & prison system.

DEMOCRACY FOR ALL

Durham belongs to all who live here: Native, refugee and migrant, Black, Brown, Latino/a, Muslim, white, and Jewish, documented and undocumented, and LGBTQ. We need all these voices at the table to create a Durham for All. Right-wing politicians in North Carolina have used voter suppression to limit whose voice counts, turned hate into law, and made policies that benefit only the wealthy. We must end this attack on the people of North Carolina, and Durham must be a leader in a revolution for real democracy in our state.

OUR PLAN

Power comes from thousands of people speaking up and deciding to take action. That\u2019s why our plan is based on building people power from the ground up. The plan has three stages:

Stage 1: Build a Mandate (2017). We will train 100+ people to ask their family, friends, neighbors, and co-workers to sign our pledge and join the movement for a Durham for All. Our goal is to get 5,000 pledges in 2017. These signatures will be a mandate for a new political vision of the city rooted in the principles of a Durham for All. We will use these principles to elect a progressive majority to Durham\u2019s City Council and hold them accountable.

Stage 2: Build a Model (2018). In the second stage, we will engage residents in a series of public forums. Our goal is to dive deeper into each issue, create a set of policy demands, and reach 10,000 pledges. We will hold neighborhood meetings, people\u2019s assemblies, demonstrations, and other events to build support for our platform and take our demands to the streets. We will also train new leaders to expand the movement. Our focus will be on leaders who are working people, people of color, and women.

Stage 3: Build a Movement (2019-2020). In the third stage, we will pass the policies outlined in the platform. We will also bring fresh ideas, skilled leaders, and thousands of voters into the critical state and federal elections in 2020. Working with groups in rural areas, towns, and other cities, we will be part of unleashing millions of engaged residents and leaders in a movement to win back North Carolina.

Click \"Join Us!\" to sign the pledge and become a part of the 10K Strong campaign!\u00a0RSVP on Facebook for our 10K Strong Block Party & GOTV Action on September 23rd. More details to come!

"}

{"pk": 9, "path": "000100010006", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Durham Para Tod@s: Fuerza de 10 Mil", "draft_title": "Durham Para Tod@s: Fuerza de 10 Mil", "slug": "durham-para-tods-fuerza-de-10-mil", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/durham-para-tods-fuerza-de-10-mil/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "Durham Para Tod@s: Fuerza de 10 Mil", "body": "

\u00a0

NUESTRO PROP\u00d3SITO

Ya lleg\u00f3 el momento de retomar nuestro gobierno y hacer que trabaje para tod@s. Las corporaciones y pol\u00edticos de derecha han manipulado el sistema pol\u00edtico, y ya no aguantamos m\u00e1s. Junt@s, estamos construyendo un movimiento fuerte en Durham con 10.000 personas de diversas razas y clases sociales.

Este sistema ama\u00f1ado solamente funciona cuando la mayor\u00eda no est\u00e1 unida. Cuando la participaci\u00f3n democr\u00e1tica es limitada y la gente dividida, quienes ganan son l@s ric@s y poderos@s. Para tener \u00e9xito, nuestro movimiento tiene que ser masivo, y debe representar a tod@s. Nuestra meta es de inspirar a 10.000 personas a tomar acci\u00f3n, porque 10.000 es el n\u00famero de personas que se requiere para elegir o destituir a nuestr@s oficiales locales. Con 10.000 personas, podemos crear una nueva y poderosa mayor\u00eda en Durham. 10.000 personas nos dar\u00e1n un mandato para lograr un cambio.

Cuando esta nueva mayor\u00eda se une en las urnas electorales y en las calles, seremos capaces de derrotar las pol\u00edticas de divisi\u00f3n y codicia. Junt@s, podemos enfrentar los problemas m\u00e1s grandes\u2014la necesidad de vivienda econ\u00f3mica, educaci\u00f3n de calidad, trabajos dignos, y verdadera seguridad. Junt@s, elegiremos a personas que usar\u00e1n los impuestos que pagamos para cumplir con las necesidades b\u00e1sicas de tod@s y luchar por un Durham donde tod@s puedan prosperar. Junt@s, exigiremos a que nuestr@s representantes locales, estatales y federales sirvan todos nuestros intereses, y no solamente los de l@s ric@s y poderos@s.

NUESTROS PRINCIPIOS

Nuestro movimiento est\u00e1 guiado por nuestras profundas creencias y una visi\u00f3n del futuro que estamos construyendo junt@s:

VIVIENDA PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos el derecho de vivir en un hogar seguro y econ\u00f3mico a su alcance. Hoy en d\u00eda en Durham, la vivienda digna es un privilegio para l@s ric@s en vez de ser un derecho de tod@s. Sabemos que la renta es demasiada alta y que l@s propietarios tienen demasiado poder sobre nuestras vidas. Sabemos que muchas personas\u2014especialmente la gente negra y latina, personas de bajos ingresos y con discapacidades - est\u00e1n siendo expulsadas de sus casas y desplazadas de sus propios vecindarios, lo cual hace dif\u00edcil formar comunidades fuertes y una vida estable. Exigimos pol\u00edticas que apoyan la vivienda econ\u00f3mica permanente, al igual que alimentos, energ\u00eda sustentable, agua limpia e internet al alcance de tod@s.

EDUCACI\u00d3N PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos derecho a una educaci\u00f3n p\u00fablica de alta calidad que nos desarrolle integralmente. Esto incluye a l@s ni\u00f1@s pobres, de color, inmigrantes y refugiad@s y ni\u00f1@s con discapacidades. Sin embargo, en realidad nuestras escuelas p\u00fablicas siguen siendo segregadas y altamente desiguales. Cada vez m\u00e1s, la educaci\u00f3n se centra en las calificaciones en los ex\u00e1menes en vez del crecimiento de nuestr@s ni\u00f1@s. Nuestras escuelas no cuentan con los recursos necesarios, y l@s que sufren son nuestr@s ni\u00f1@s. Nos oponemos a la cancelaci\u00f3n de programas de arte, educaci\u00f3n f\u00edsica, recreo y servicios para ni\u00f1@s con necesidades especiales. Exigimos escuelas p\u00fablicas bien financiadas que educan a las personas de manera integral desde la edad preescolar hasta la universidad/escuela profesional, y que ayudan a l@s ni\u00f1@s a convertirse en adultos felices, saludables y pr\u00f3sper@s.

ECONOM\u00cdA PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos derecho a los recursos necesarios para sostenerse a si mism@ y a sus familias, y el derecho a vivir en un planeta saludable. Las grandes corporaciones lucran mucho en Durham, pero muchas de las mismas mantienen a sus trabajador@s en empleos con salarios de miseria, da\u00f1an al medio ambiente y no pagan los impuestos que deben. Nuestr@s abuel@s, las personas con descapacidades, y personas con antecedentes penales son frecuentemente olvidad@s en nuestra econom\u00eda. Necesitamos mayor aceso a los empleos saludables, sustentables, y de salario digno, con buenas prestaciones, para que nuestra comunidad pueda prosperar. Queremos pol\u00edticas que reparten nuestra riqueza de manera m\u00e1s equitativa, elevando los salarios, creando oportunidades de empleo, y manteniendo nuestros recursos dentro de nuestra comunidad. Queremos el derecho de organizar sindicatos y luchar en conjunto por la dignidad y la seguridad en el trabajo.

SANTUARIO PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos el derecho de sentir segur@s en nuestros cuerpos, casas y comunidades. Demasiadas personas en Durham viven con el miedo de violencia de parte de la polic\u00eda. Demasiadas personas viven con miedo de las leyes y oficiales que fomentan el odio y la discriminaci\u00f3n. Demasiadas personas viven con miedo de la violencia en sus hogares o sus vecindarios. Queremos un fin a la violencia policial, al monitoreo de l@s musulmanes, las redadas de ICE y a las pol\u00edticas que lastiman a las mujeres y las personas LGBTQ. Exigimos pol\u00edticas que promuevan una verdadera seguridad comunitaria al acabar con la criminalizaci\u00f3n y el encarcelamiento masivo para invertir en los empleos, la vivienda, cuidado m\u00e9dico, educaci\u00f3n y soluciones para una justicia basada en las comunidades y m\u00e1s all\u00e1 del sistema de polic\u00eda y de c\u00e1rceles.

DEMOCRACIA PARA TOD@S

Durham nos pertenece a todas las personas que vivimos aqu\u00ed: nacidas aqu\u00ed, refugiadas y migrantes, negras, latinas, musulmanes, blancas y jud\u00edas, con o sin documentos y LGBTQ. Necesitamos todas estas voces para crear un Durham para Tod@s. Oficiales de derecha en Carolina del Norte han usado la represi\u00f3n de votantes para limitar las voces que cuentan, han convertido el odio en la ley, y han promulgado pol\u00edticas que solamente favorecen a l@s ric@s. Tenemos que poner fin a este ataque contra el pueblo de Carolina del Norte, y Durham tiene que estar en la vanguardia de una revoluci\u00f3n por una democracia verdadera en nuestro estado.

NUESTRO PLAN

El poder viene de miles de personas que alzan su voz y que deciden tomar acci\u00f3n. Por eso, nuestro plan se basa en la construcci\u00f3n del poder popular desde las bases. El plan tiene 3 etapas:

Etapa 1: Construir un Mandato (2017). Vamos a capacitar a m\u00e1s de 100 personas que van a pedir a sus familias, amig@s, vecin@s y colegas a que se unan a nuestro movimiento por un Durham para Tod@s. Nuestra meta es de conseguir 10.000 firmantes. Estas firmas representar\u00e1n un mandato por una nueva visi\u00f3n pol\u00edtica de una ciudad arraigada en los principios de un Durham para Tod@s. Vamos a usar estos mismos principios para elegir una mayor\u00eda progresista en el Concejo Municipal de Durham y hacer que rinda cuentas.

Etapa 2: Construir el Modelo (2018). En la segunda etapa, vamos a involucrar a l@s residentes de Durham en foros pol\u00edticos. Nuestra meta es de profundizar m\u00e1s sobre cada tema y crear un pliego de demandas pol\u00edticas. Vamos a organizar una serie de reuniones de vecindario, asambleas populares, manifestaciones y otros eventos para conseguir apoyo para nuestra plataforma y para llevar nuestras demandas a las calles. Tambi\u00e9n vamos a formar a nuev@s l\u00edderes para expandir nuestro movimiento. Nos enfocaremos en aquell@s l\u00edderes que son personas de clase obrera, personas de color y mujeres.

Etapa 3: Construir un Movimiento (2019-2020). En la tercera etapa, vamos a promulgar las pol\u00edticas incluidas en la plataforma. Tambi\u00e9n vamos a traer nuevas ideas, l\u00edderes bien formad@s y miles de votantes a las elecciones estatales y federales tan cr\u00edticos del 2020. Al colaborar con grupos en zonas rurales, pueblitos y otras sociedades, seremos parte de una ola de millones de residentes y l\u00edderes dedicad@s al movimiento para recuperar la democracia en Carolina del Norte.

"}

VIVIENDA PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos el derecho de vivir en un hogar seguro y econ\u00f3mico a su alcance. Hoy en d\u00eda en Durham, la vivienda digna es un privilegio para l@s ric@s en vez de ser un derecho de tod@s. Sabemos que la renta es demasiada alta y que l@s propietarios tienen demasiado poder sobre nuestras vidas. Sabemos que muchas personas\u2014especialmente la gente negra y latina, personas de bajos ingresos y con discapacidades - est\u00e1n siendo expulsadas de sus casas y desplazadas de sus propios vecindarios, lo cual hace dif\u00edcil formar comunidades fuertes y una vida estable. Exigimos pol\u00edticas que apoyan la vivienda econ\u00f3mica permanente, al igual que alimentos, energ\u00eda sustentable, agua limpia e internet al alcance de tod@s.

EDUCACI\u00d3N PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos derecho a una educaci\u00f3n p\u00fablica de alta calidad que nos desarrolle integralmente. Esto incluye a l@s ni\u00f1@s pobres, de color, inmigrantes y refugiad@s y ni\u00f1@s con discapacidades. Sin embargo, en realidad nuestras escuelas p\u00fablicas siguen siendo segregadas y altamente desiguales. Cada vez m\u00e1s, la educaci\u00f3n se centra en las calificaciones en los ex\u00e1menes en vez del crecimiento de nuestr@s ni\u00f1@s. Nuestras escuelas no cuentan con los recursos necesarios, y l@s que sufren son nuestr@s ni\u00f1@s. Nos oponemos a la cancelaci\u00f3n de programas de arte, educaci\u00f3n f\u00edsica, recreo y servicios para ni\u00f1@s con necesidades especiales. Exigimos escuelas p\u00fablicas bien financiadas que educan a las personas de manera integral desde la edad preescolar hasta la universidad/escuela profesional, y que ayudan a l@s ni\u00f1@s a convertirse en adultos felices, saludables y pr\u00f3sper@s.

ECONOM\u00cdA PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos derecho a los recursos necesarios para sostenerse a si mism@ y a sus familias, y el derecho a vivir en un planeta saludable. Las grandes corporaciones lucran mucho en Durham, pero muchas de las mismas mantienen a sus trabajador@s en empleos con salarios de miseria, da\u00f1an al medio ambiente y no pagan los impuestos que deben. Nuestr@s abuel@s, las personas con descapacidades, y personas con antecedentes penales son frecuentemente olvidad@s en nuestra econom\u00eda. Necesitamos mayor aceso a los empleos saludables, sustentables, y de salario digno, con buenas prestaciones, para que nuestra comunidad pueda prosperar. Queremos pol\u00edticas que reparten nuestra riqueza de manera m\u00e1s equitativa, elevando los salarios, creando oportunidades de empleo, y manteniendo nuestros recursos dentro de nuestra comunidad. Queremos el derecho de organizar sindicatos y luchar en conjunto por la dignidad y la seguridad en el trabajo.

SANTUARIO PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos el derecho de sentir segur@s en nuestros cuerpos, casas y comunidades. Demasiadas personas en Durham viven con el miedo de violencia de parte de la polic\u00eda. Demasiadas personas viven con miedo de las leyes y oficiales que fomentan el odio y la discriminaci\u00f3n. Demasiadas personas viven con miedo de la violencia en sus hogares o sus vecindarios. Queremos un fin a la violencia policial, al monitoreo de l@s musulmanes, las redadas de ICE y a las pol\u00edticas que lastiman a las mujeres y las personas LGBTQ. Exigimos pol\u00edticas que promuevan una verdadera seguridad comunitaria al acabar con la criminalizaci\u00f3n y el encarcelamiento masivo para invertir en los empleos, la vivienda, cuidado m\u00e9dico, educaci\u00f3n y soluciones para una justicia basada en las comunidades y m\u00e1s all\u00e1 del sistema de polic\u00eda y de c\u00e1rceles.

DEMOCRACIA PARA TOD@S

Durham nos pertenece a todas las personas que vivimos aqu\u00ed: nacidas aqu\u00ed, refugiadas y migrantes, negras, latinas, musulmanes, blancas y jud\u00edas, con o sin documentos y LGBTQ. Necesitamos todas estas voces para crear un Durham para Tod@s. Oficiales de derecha en Carolina del Norte han usado la represi\u00f3n de votantes para limitar las voces que cuentan, han convertido el odio en la ley, y han promulgado pol\u00edticas que solamente favorecen a l@s ric@s. Tenemos que poner fin a este ataque contra el pueblo de Carolina del Norte, y Durham tiene que estar en la vanguardia de una revoluci\u00f3n por una democracia verdadera en nuestro estado.

NUESTRO PLAN

El poder viene de miles de personas que alzan su voz y que deciden tomar acci\u00f3n. Por eso, nuestro plan se basa en la construcci\u00f3n del poder popular desde las bases. El plan tiene 3 etapas:

Etapa 1: Construir un Mandato (2017). Vamos a capacitar a m\u00e1s de 100 personas que van a pedir a sus familias, amig@s, vecin@s y colegas a que se unan a nuestro movimiento por un Durham para Tod@s. Nuestra meta es de conseguir 10.000 firmantes. Estas firmas representar\u00e1n un mandato por una nueva visi\u00f3n pol\u00edtica de una ciudad arraigada en los principios de un Durham para Tod@s. Vamos a usar estos mismos principios para elegir una mayor\u00eda progresista en el Concejo Municipal de Durham y hacer que rinda cuentas.

Etapa 2: Construir el Modelo (2018). En la segunda etapa, vamos a involucrar a l@s residentes de Durham en foros pol\u00edticos. Nuestra meta es de profundizar m\u00e1s sobre cada tema y crear un pliego de demandas pol\u00edticas. Vamos a organizar una serie de reuniones de vecindario, asambleas populares, manifestaciones y otros eventos para conseguir apoyo para nuestra plataforma y para llevar nuestras demandas a las calles. Tambi\u00e9n vamos a formar a nuev@s l\u00edderes para expandir nuestro movimiento. Nos enfocaremos en aquell@s l\u00edderes que son personas de clase obrera, personas de color y mujeres.

Etapa 3: Construir un Movimiento (2019-2020). En la tercera etapa, vamos a promulgar las pol\u00edticas incluidas en la plataforma. Tambi\u00e9n vamos a traer nuevas ideas, l\u00edderes bien formad@s y miles de votantes a las elecciones estatales y federales tan cr\u00edticos del 2020. Al colaborar con grupos en zonas rurales, pueblitos y otras sociedades, seremos parte de una ola de millones de residentes y l\u00edderes dedicad@s al movimiento para recuperar la democracia en Carolina del Norte.

"}

{"pk": 5, "path": "000100010002", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Vision and Mission", "draft_title": "Vision and Mission", "slug": "vision_and_mission", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/vision_and_mission/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:01:21.518Z", "last_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:01:54.398Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2017-09-12T04:01:54.253Z", "live_revision": 3, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "Vision and Mission", "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph\", \"value\": \"

2016 LAUNCH YEAR VISION

Our\\u00a0vision\\u00a0is of a\\u00a0Durham For All!

  • an alternative economic development model for how Durham is run, in contrast to self-interested developers and corporations
  • a practice of participatory democracy that demands equity and confronts two separate, unequal Durhams which only serve a privileged few


We envision a Durham that:

  • grows through inclusion
  • confronts disparity and demands equity
  • governs based on progressive principles of racial, economic, and environmental justice
  • is rooted in working class people of color communities
  • focuses on our local level while being grounded in a systemic analysis that responds to changing conditions at all levels
  • creates replicable city-scale projects that can impact and shift the balance of power at the state and national levels

2016 LAUNCH YEAR MISSION

Durham For All's mission is to develop and maintain a political vehicle rooted in and led by working class people of color that builds political power to win. To accomplish this, we will:

  • use neighborhood, place-based organizing
  • engage in both electoral politics and issue-based campaigns
  • explore solidarity economies, people's assemblies, and creative engagement
  • develop and implement a broad progressive agenda, vision, and narrative for how Durham should be organized, in opposition to corporate & development power
  • unite and cohere an array of multi-racial, progressive political forces in Durham so that we can collectively win!
\", \"id\": \"04e31a75-7928-401f-9434-6bf37269dcff\"}]"}

{"pk": 6, "path": "000100010003", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Who We Are", "draft_title": "Who We Are", "slug": "who_we_are", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/who_we_are/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:03:07.534Z", "last_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:03:07.534Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2017-09-12T04:03:07.367Z", "live_revision": 4, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "Who We Are", "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph\", \"value\": \"

Durham For All launched in early 2016, but before then our founding team engaged in different issue-based organizing across Durham over the years. In 2014 and 2015, members of our founding team began experimenting with building political power through local elections, and we helped win young, progressive, people of color into local offices.

Durham For All is made up of a four-person Coordinating Team to bottom-line daily operations and a larger Campaign Team that is leading our\\u00a010K Strong Campaign! Our core leadership is primary people of color, and our entire team is a multiracial, cross-class alliance of Durham organizers and activists with a range of skill-sets and progressive movement experience.

Durham For All is an independent political organization, and a 501(c)(4).

\", \"id\": \"2d507b8b-b30a-4c77-b986-f692f545a91f\"}]"}

{"pk": 7, "path": "000100010004", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "2016 Efforts", "draft_title": "2016 Efforts", "slug": "2016_efforts", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/2016_efforts/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:03:58.143Z", "last_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:04:17.854Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2017-09-12T04:04:17.767Z", "live_revision": 6, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "2016 Efforts", "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph\", \"value\": \"

NEIGHBORHOOD STABILIZATION ADVOCACY CAMPAIGN

(Early-Mid 2016)

As a result of the recent home revaluations, the average increase in home property values across Durham County is around 12%. But in Black & Brown working class neighborhoods that are rapidly gentrifying, there is a potential for property taxes to double or more than triple by 2017. In order to shift resources to working class residents, Durham For All:

  • Knocked on hundreds of doors to educate Northeast Central Durham (NECD) residents on the impact of the Property Tax Revaluation and availability of existing tax relief resources for homeowners
  • Worked with residents and city officials to advocate for a revamp of Durham's minor home repairs program as a way to provide tax relief for homeowners and to protect the cost of housing for renters

BASE BUILDING & RELATIONSHIP BUILDING

(Mid-Late 2016)

In the summer, Durham For All formed a team to lead base building in Durham's Precinct 14 in NECD. We have:

  • Continued to knock on hundreds of more doors, talking with folks in English and Spanish to learn about the issues they care about most, share our vision of political power, and invite them to get involved
  • Connected with leaders and groups in NECD
  • Held various community conversations about political power building with community members
  • Hosted a September Block Party next to East Durham Park, where hundreds came out to party and learn about Durham For All
  • Partnered with\\u00a0BYP 100 Durham\\u00a0in late October to lead a March to the Polls event from East Durham Park
  • Participated in the first Assembly of Latino Organizations in NC with Latin@ community members we met through door knocking

LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT

Throughout 2016, we are investing deeply in leadership development by:

  • expanding our team and participating in a collective study & practice process with new members
  • sending some of our team to a two-part, 8-day leadership course called\\u00a0Transformation in Action by Generative Somatics\\u00a0and a three-day alternative economies conference in Buffalo, New York, called\\u00a0CommonBound
  • building the leadership of Black & Brown residents in working class neighborhoods through trainings and shared practice in:
    • door knocking
    • event mobilization
    • public speaking
    • relationship building, and more!
\", \"id\": \"0abdd79c-95e6-47d5-a1f6-395031632010\"}]"}

{"pk": 8, "path": "000100010005", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Durham For All: 10K Strong", "draft_title": "Durham For All: 10K Strong", "slug": "10kstrong", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/10kstrong/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:05:27.743Z", "last_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:06:36.052Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2017-09-12T04:06:35.952Z", "live_revision": 9, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "10k Strong", "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph\", \"value\": \"

Haga clic aqu\\u00ed para la versi\\u00f3n en espa\\u00f1ol.

Below is the\\u00a010K Strong Pledge, written by Durham For All, with the support of a range of progressive community leaders across Durham.\\u00a0

\\u00a0

Click \\\"Join Us!\\\" to sign the pledge and become a part of the 10K Strong campaign!\\u00a0RSVP on Facebook for our 10K Strong Block Party & GOTV Action on September 23rd. More details to come!


OUR PURPOSE

It\\u2019s time to win back our government and put it to work for all of us. Corporations and right-wing politicians have rigged the political system, and we\\u2019ve had enough. Together, we are building a cross-class, multiracial movement in Durham that is 10,000 people strong.

This rigged system only works when the majority of people aren\\u2019t taking action together. When democratic participation is small and people are divided, the wealthy and powerful win. To be successful, our movement needs to be massive and stand up for all of us. Our goal is to bring 10,000 people into action, because 10,000 is the number of people we need to elect or un-elect local elected officials. With 10,000 people, we can create a new, powerful majority in Durham. 10,000 people gives us a mandate for change.

When this new majority unites at the ballot box and in the streets, we will defeat the politics of division and greed. Together, we will address our biggest problems \\u2014 the need for affordable homes, quality education, good jobs, and real safety. Together, we will elect people that will use our tax dollars to meet each person\\u2019s basic needs and fight for a Durham where everyone can thrive. Together, we will demand that our local, state, and federal representatives serve all of our interests, not just the interests of the wealthy and powerful.

OUR PRINCIPLES

Our movement is guided by our deepest beliefs and a vision of the future we\\u2019re building together:

HOMES FOR ALL

Everyone has the right to live in a safe and affordable home. Right now in Durham, decent homes are a privilege of the wealthy rather than a right for all. We know that the rents are too high and that landlords have too much power over our lives. We know that many people \\u2014 especially Black and Brown people, low-income people, and disabled people are being forced out of their homes and their neighborhoods. This makes it hard to build community and a stable life. We demand policies that support permanent affordable housing as well as food, clean energy, clean water, and internet that everyone can afford.

EDUCATION FOR ALL

Everyone has the right to a high-quality public education that fully develops their potential. This includes poor children, children of color, immigrant and refugee children, and children with disabilities. However, the reality is that our public schools are segregated and deeply unequal. Education has become more focused on test scores than supporting our children\\u2019s growth. Our schools don\\u2019t have the resources they need, and it is our kids who suffer. We oppose cutting the arts, physical education, recess, and services for children with special needs. We demand well-funded public schools that educate whole people from preschool to college/trade school and help children develop into happy, healthy and thriving adults.

ECONOMY FOR ALL

Everyone has the right to the resources they need to sustain themselves and their families and to live on a healthy planet. Big corporations make a lot of money in Durham, but many keep workers in poverty-wage jobs, harm the environment, and don\\u2019t pay their fair share of taxes. Our elders, disabled people, and people with criminal records are often left out of the economy. We need more access to safe, green, living-wage jobs with good benefits for our community to thrive. We want policies that spread wealth more equally by raising wages, creating job opportunities, and keeping money in our community. We want the right to organize unions and fight together for dignity and safety at work.

SANCTUARY FOR ALL

Everyone deserves to feel safe and secure in their bodies, homes, and communities. Too many people in Durham live in fear of violence at the hands of law enforcement. Too many live in fear of laws and politicians who promote hate and discrimination. Too many live in fear of violence in their homes or neighborhoods. We want an end to police violence, surveillance of Muslims, ICE raids, and policies that harm women and LGBTQ people. We call for policies that promote real community safety by divesting from criminalization and mass incarceration and investing in jobs, housing, healthcare, education, and community-based justice solutions outside of the police & prison system.

DEMOCRACY FOR ALL

Durham belongs to all who live here: Native, refugee and migrant, Black, Brown, Latino/a, Muslim, white, and Jewish, documented and undocumented, and LGBTQ. We need all these voices at the table to create a Durham for All. Right-wing politicians in North Carolina have used voter suppression to limit whose voice counts, turned hate into law, and made policies that benefit only the wealthy. We must end this attack on the people of North Carolina, and Durham must be a leader in a revolution for real democracy in our state.

OUR PLAN

Power comes from thousands of people speaking up and deciding to take action. That\\u2019s why our plan is based on building people power from the ground up. The plan has three stages:

Stage 1: Build a Mandate (2017). We will train 100+ people to ask their family, friends, neighbors, and co-workers to sign our pledge and join the movement for a Durham for All. Our goal is to get 5,000 pledges in 2017. These signatures will be a mandate for a new political vision of the city rooted in the principles of a Durham for All. We will use these principles to elect a progressive majority to Durham\\u2019s City Council and hold them accountable.

Stage 2: Build a Model (2018). In the second stage, we will engage residents in a series of public forums. Our goal is to dive deeper into each issue, create a set of policy demands, and reach 10,000 pledges. We will hold neighborhood meetings, people\\u2019s assemblies, demonstrations, and other events to build support for our platform and take our demands to the streets. We will also train new leaders to expand the movement. Our focus will be on leaders who are working people, people of color, and women.

Stage 3: Build a Movement (2019-2020). In the third stage, we will pass the policies outlined in the platform. We will also bring fresh ideas, skilled leaders, and thousands of voters into the critical state and federal elections in 2020. Working with groups in rural areas, towns, and other cities, we will be part of unleashing millions of engaged residents and leaders in a movement to win back North Carolina.

Click \\\"Join Us!\\\" to sign the pledge and become a part of the 10K Strong campaign!\\u00a0RSVP on Facebook for our 10K Strong Block Party & GOTV Action on September 23rd. More details to come!


\", \"id\": \"630855b9-e079-4317-9133-fa6403d307a7\"}]"}

{"pk": 9, "path": "000100010006", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Durham Para Tod@s: Fuerza de 10 Mil", "draft_title": "Durham Para Tod@s: Fuerza de 10 Mil", "slug": "fuerzade10mil", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/fuerzade10mil/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "fuerzade10mil", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:08:13.650Z", "last_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:09:45.055Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2017-09-12T04:09:44.929Z", "live_revision": 12, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "Durham Para Tod@s: Fuerza de 10 Mil", "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph\", \"value\": \"

\\u00a0

NUESTRO PROP\\u00d3SITO

Ya lleg\\u00f3 el momento de retomar nuestro gobierno y hacer que trabaje para tod@s. Las corporaciones y pol\\u00edticos de derecha han manipulado el sistema pol\\u00edtico, y ya no aguantamos m\\u00e1s. Junt@s, estamos construyendo un movimiento fuerte en Durham con 10.000 personas de diversas razas y clases sociales.

Este sistema ama\\u00f1ado solamente funciona cuando la mayor\\u00eda no est\\u00e1 unida. Cuando la participaci\\u00f3n democr\\u00e1tica es limitada y la gente dividida, quienes ganan son l@s ric@s y poderos@s. Para tener \\u00e9xito, nuestro movimiento tiene que ser masivo, y debe representar a tod@s. Nuestra meta es de inspirar a 10.000 personas a tomar acci\\u00f3n, porque 10.000 es el n\\u00famero de personas que se requiere para elegir o destituir a nuestr@s oficiales locales. Con 10.000 personas, podemos crear una nueva y poderosa mayor\\u00eda en Durham. 10.000 personas nos dar\\u00e1n un mandato para lograr un cambio.

Cuando esta nueva mayor\\u00eda se une en las urnas electorales y en las calles, seremos capaces de derrotar las pol\\u00edticas de divisi\\u00f3n y codicia. Junt@s, podemos enfrentar los problemas m\\u00e1s grandes\\u2014la necesidad de vivienda econ\\u00f3mica, educaci\\u00f3n de calidad, trabajos dignos, y verdadera seguridad. Junt@s, elegiremos a personas que usar\\u00e1n los impuestos que pagamos para cumplir con las necesidades b\\u00e1sicas de tod@s y luchar por un Durham donde tod@s puedan prosperar. Junt@s, exigiremos a que nuestr@s representantes locales, estatales y federales sirvan todos nuestros intereses, y no solamente los de l@s ric@s y poderos@s.

NUESTROS PRINCIPIOS

Nuestro movimiento est\\u00e1 guiado por nuestras profundas creencias y una visi\\u00f3n del futuro que estamos construyendo junt@s:

VIVIENDA PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos el derecho de vivir en un hogar seguro y econ\\u00f3mico a su alcance. Hoy en d\\u00eda en Durham, la vivienda digna es un privilegio para l@s ric@s en vez de ser un derecho de tod@s. Sabemos que la renta es demasiada alta y que l@s propietarios tienen demasiado poder sobre nuestras vidas. Sabemos que muchas personas\\u2014especialmente la gente negra y latina, personas de bajos ingresos y con discapacidades - est\\u00e1n siendo expulsadas de sus casas y desplazadas de sus propios vecindarios, lo cual hace dif\\u00edcil formar comunidades fuertes y una vida estable. Exigimos pol\\u00edticas que apoyan la vivienda econ\\u00f3mica permanente, al igual que alimentos, energ\\u00eda sustentable, agua limpia e internet al alcance de tod@s.

EDUCACI\\u00d3N PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos derecho a una educaci\\u00f3n p\\u00fablica de alta calidad que nos desarrolle integralmente. Esto incluye a l@s ni\\u00f1@s pobres, de color, inmigrantes y refugiad@s y ni\\u00f1@s con discapacidades. Sin embargo, en realidad nuestras escuelas p\\u00fablicas siguen siendo segregadas y altamente desiguales. Cada vez m\\u00e1s, la educaci\\u00f3n se centra en las calificaciones en los ex\\u00e1menes en vez del crecimiento de nuestr@s ni\\u00f1@s. Nuestras escuelas no cuentan con los recursos necesarios, y l@s que sufren son nuestr@s ni\\u00f1@s. Nos oponemos a la cancelaci\\u00f3n de programas de arte, educaci\\u00f3n f\\u00edsica, recreo y servicios para ni\\u00f1@s con necesidades especiales. Exigimos escuelas p\\u00fablicas bien financiadas que educan a las personas de manera integral desde la edad preescolar hasta la universidad/escuela profesional, y que ayudan a l@s ni\\u00f1@s a convertirse en adultos felices, saludables y pr\\u00f3sper@s.

ECONOM\\u00cdA PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos derecho a los recursos necesarios para sostenerse a si mism@ y a sus familias, y el derecho a vivir en un planeta saludable. Las grandes corporaciones lucran mucho en Durham, pero muchas de las mismas mantienen a sus trabajador@s en empleos con salarios de miseria, da\\u00f1an al medio ambiente y no pagan los impuestos que deben. Nuestr@s abuel@s, las personas con descapacidades, y personas con antecedentes penales son frecuentemente olvidad@s en nuestra econom\\u00eda. Necesitamos mayor aceso a los empleos saludables, sustentables, y de salario digno, con buenas prestaciones, para que nuestra comunidad pueda prosperar. Queremos pol\\u00edticas que reparten nuestra riqueza de manera m\\u00e1s equitativa, elevando los salarios, creando oportunidades de empleo, y manteniendo nuestros recursos dentro de nuestra comunidad. Queremos el derecho de organizar sindicatos y luchar en conjunto por la dignidad y la seguridad en el trabajo.

SANTUARIO PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos el derecho de sentir segur@s en nuestros cuerpos, casas y comunidades. Demasiadas personas en Durham viven con el miedo de violencia de parte de la polic\\u00eda. Demasiadas personas viven con miedo de las leyes y oficiales que fomentan el odio y la discriminaci\\u00f3n. Demasiadas personas viven con miedo de la violencia en sus hogares o sus vecindarios. Queremos un fin a la violencia policial, al monitoreo de l@s musulmanes, las redadas de ICE y a las pol\\u00edticas que lastiman a las mujeres y las personas LGBTQ. Exigimos pol\\u00edticas que promuevan una verdadera seguridad comunitaria al acabar con la criminalizaci\\u00f3n y el encarcelamiento masivo para invertir en los empleos, la vivienda, cuidado m\\u00e9dico, educaci\\u00f3n y soluciones para una justicia basada en las comunidades y m\\u00e1s all\\u00e1 del sistema de polic\\u00eda y de c\\u00e1rceles.

DEMOCRACIA PARA TOD@S

Durham nos pertenece a todas las personas que vivimos aqu\\u00ed: nacidas aqu\\u00ed, refugiadas y migrantes, negras, latinas, musulmanes, blancas y jud\\u00edas, con o sin documentos y LGBTQ. Necesitamos todas estas voces para crear un Durham para Tod@s. Oficiales de derecha en Carolina del Norte han usado la represi\\u00f3n de votantes para limitar las voces que cuentan, han convertido el odio en la ley, y han promulgado pol\\u00edticas que solamente favorecen a l@s ric@s. Tenemos que poner fin a este ataque contra el pueblo de Carolina del Norte, y Durham tiene que estar en la vanguardia de una revoluci\\u00f3n por una democracia verdadera en nuestro estado.

NUESTRO PLAN

El poder viene de miles de personas que alzan su voz y que deciden tomar acci\\u00f3n. Por eso, nuestro plan se basa en la construcci\\u00f3n del poder popular desde las bases. El plan tiene 3 etapas:

Etapa 1: Construir un Mandato (2017). Vamos a capacitar a m\\u00e1s de 100 personas que van a pedir a sus familias, amig@s, vecin@s y colegas a que se unan a nuestro movimiento por un Durham para Tod@s. Nuestra meta es de conseguir 10.000 firmantes. Estas firmas representar\\u00e1n un mandato por una nueva visi\\u00f3n pol\\u00edtica de una ciudad arraigada en los principios de un Durham para Tod@s. Vamos a usar estos mismos principios para elegir una mayor\\u00eda progresista en el Concejo Municipal de Durham y hacer que rinda cuentas.

Etapa 2: Construir el Modelo (2018). En la segunda etapa, vamos a involucrar a l@s residentes de Durham en foros pol\\u00edticos. Nuestra meta es de profundizar m\\u00e1s sobre cada tema y crear un pliego de demandas pol\\u00edticas. Vamos a organizar una serie de reuniones de vecindario, asambleas populares, manifestaciones y otros eventos para conseguir apoyo para nuestra plataforma y para llevar nuestras demandas a las calles. Tambi\\u00e9n vamos a formar a nuev@s l\\u00edderes para expandir nuestro movimiento. Nos enfocaremos en aquell@s l\\u00edderes que son personas de clase obrera, personas de color y mujeres.

Etapa 3: Construir un Movimiento (2019-2020). En la tercera etapa, vamos a promulgar las pol\\u00edticas incluidas en la plataforma. Tambi\\u00e9n vamos a traer nuevas ideas, l\\u00edderes bien formad@s y miles de votantes a las elecciones estatales y federales tan cr\\u00edticos del 2020. Al colaborar con grupos en zonas rurales, pueblitos y otras sociedades, seremos parte de una ola de millones de residentes y l\\u00edderes dedicad@s al movimiento para recuperar la democracia en Carolina del Norte.

{"pk": 8, "path": "000100010005", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Durham For All: 10K Strong", "draft_title": "Durham For All: 10K Strong", "slug": "10kstrong", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/10kstrong/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:05:27.743Z", "last_published_at": "2017-10-16T03:42:32.800Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2017-10-16T03:42:32.750Z", "live_revision": 21, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "10k Strong", "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph\", \"value\": \"

Haga clic aqu\\u00ed para la versi\\u00f3n en espa\\u00f1ol.

Below is the\\u00a010K Strong Pledge, written by Durham For All, with the support of a range of progressive community leaders across Durham.\\u00a0

\\u00a0

Click \\\"Join Us!\\\" to sign the pledge and become a part of the 10K Strong campaign!\\u00a0RSVP on Facebook for our 10K Strong Block Party & GOTV Action on September 23rd. More details to come!


OUR PURPOSE

It\\u2019s time to win back our government and put it to work for all of us. Corporations and right-wing politicians have rigged the political system, and we\\u2019ve had enough. Together, we are building a cross-class, multiracial movement in Durham that is 10,000 people strong.

This rigged system only works when the majority of people aren\\u2019t taking action together. When democratic participation is small and people are divided, the wealthy and powerful win. To be successful, our movement needs to be massive and stand up for all of us. Our goal is to bring 10,000 people into action, because 10,000 is the number of people we need to elect or un-elect local elected officials. With 10,000 people, we can create a new, powerful majority in Durham. 10,000 people gives us a mandate for change.

When this new majority unites at the ballot box and in the streets, we will defeat the politics of division and greed. Together, we will address our biggest problems \\u2014 the need for affordable homes, quality education, good jobs, and real safety. Together, we will elect people that will use our tax dollars to meet each person\\u2019s basic needs and fight for a Durham where everyone can thrive. Together, we will demand that our local, state, and federal representatives serve all of our interests, not just the interests of the wealthy and powerful.

OUR PRINCIPLES

Our movement is guided by our deepest beliefs and a vision of the future we\\u2019re building together:

HOMES FOR ALL

Everyone has the right to live in a safe and affordable home. Right now in Durham, decent homes are a privilege of the wealthy rather than a right for all. We know that the rents are too high and that landlords have too much power over our lives. We know that many people \\u2014 especially Black and Brown people, low-income people, and disabled people are being forced out of their homes and their neighborhoods. This makes it hard to build community and a stable life. We demand policies that support permanent affordable housing as well as food, clean energy, clean water, and internet that everyone can afford.

EDUCATION FOR ALL

Everyone has the right to a high-quality public education that fully develops their potential. This includes poor children, children of color, immigrant and refugee children, and children with disabilities. However, the reality is that our public schools are segregated and deeply unequal. Education has become more focused on test scores than supporting our children\\u2019s growth. Our schools don\\u2019t have the resources they need, and it is our kids who suffer. We oppose cutting the arts, physical education, recess, and services for children with special needs. We demand well-funded public schools that educate whole people from preschool to college/trade school and help children develop into happy, healthy and thriving adults.

ECONOMY FOR ALL

Everyone has the right to the resources they need to sustain themselves and their families and to live on a healthy planet. Big corporations make a lot of money in Durham, but many keep workers in poverty-wage jobs, harm the environment, and don\\u2019t pay their fair share of taxes. Our elders, disabled people, and people with criminal records are often left out of the economy. We need more access to safe, green, living-wage jobs with good benefits for our community to thrive. We want policies that spread wealth more equally by raising wages, creating job opportunities, and keeping money in our community. We want the right to organize unions and fight together for dignity and safety at work.

SANCTUARY FOR ALL

Everyone deserves to feel safe and secure in their bodies, homes, and communities. Too many people in Durham live in fear of violence at the hands of law enforcement. Too many live in fear of laws and politicians who promote hate and discrimination. Too many live in fear of violence in their homes or neighborhoods. We want an end to police violence, surveillance of Muslims, ICE raids, and policies that harm women and LGBTQ people. We call for policies that promote real community safety by divesting from criminalization and mass incarceration and investing in jobs, housing, healthcare, education, and community-based justice solutions outside of the police & prison system.

DEMOCRACY FOR ALL

Durham belongs to all who live here: Native, refugee and migrant, Black, Brown, Latino/a, Muslim, white, and Jewish, documented and undocumented, and LGBTQ. We need all these voices at the table to create a Durham for All. Right-wing politicians in North Carolina have used voter suppression to limit whose voice counts, turned hate into law, and made policies that benefit only the wealthy. We must end this attack on the people of North Carolina, and Durham must be a leader in a revolution for real democracy in our state.

OUR PLAN

Power comes from thousands of people speaking up and deciding to take action. That\\u2019s why our plan is based on building people power from the ground up. The plan has three stages:

Stage 1: Build a Mandate (2017). We will train 100+ people to ask their family, friends, neighbors, and co-workers to sign our pledge and join the movement for a Durham for All. Our goal is to get 5,000 pledges in 2017. These signatures will be a mandate for a new political vision of the city rooted in the principles of a Durham for All. We will use these principles to elect a progressive majority to Durham\\u2019s City Council and hold them accountable.

Stage 2: Build a Model (2018). In the second stage, we will engage residents in a series of public forums. Our goal is to dive deeper into each issue, create a set of policy demands, and reach 10,000 pledges. We will hold neighborhood meetings, people\\u2019s assemblies, demonstrations, and other events to build support for our platform and take our demands to the streets. We will also train new leaders to expand the movement. Our focus will be on leaders who are working people, people of color, and women.

Stage 3: Build a Movement (2019-2020). In the third stage, we will pass the policies outlined in the platform. We will also bring fresh ideas, skilled leaders, and thousands of voters into the critical state and federal elections in 2020. Working with groups in rural areas, towns, and other cities, we will be part of unleashing millions of engaged residents and leaders in a movement to win back North Carolina.

Click \\\"Join Us!\\\" to sign the pledge and become a part of the 10K Strong campaign!\\u00a0RSVP on Facebook for our 10K Strong Block Party & GOTV Action on September 23rd. More details to come!

{"pk": 9, "path": "000100010006", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Durham Para Tod@s: Fuerza de 10 Mil", "draft_title": "Durham Para Tod@s: Fuerza de 10 Mil", "slug": "fuerzade10mil", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/fuerzade10mil/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "fuerzade10mil", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:08:13.650Z", "last_published_at": "2017-10-16T03:43:23.040Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2017-10-16T03:43:22.993Z", "live_revision": 22, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "Durham Para Tod@s: Fuerza de 10 Mil", "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph\", \"value\": \"

\\u00a0

NUESTRO PROP\\u00d3SITO

Ya lleg\\u00f3 el momento de retomar nuestro gobierno y hacer que trabaje para tod@s. Las corporaciones y pol\\u00edticos de derecha han manipulado el sistema pol\\u00edtico, y ya no aguantamos m\\u00e1s. Junt@s, estamos construyendo un movimiento fuerte en Durham con 10.000 personas de diversas razas y clases sociales.

Este sistema ama\\u00f1ado solamente funciona cuando la mayor\\u00eda no est\\u00e1 unida. Cuando la participaci\\u00f3n democr\\u00e1tica es limitada y la gente dividida, quienes ganan son l@s ric@s y poderos@s. Para tener \\u00e9xito, nuestro movimiento tiene que ser masivo, y debe representar a tod@s. Nuestra meta es de inspirar a 10.000 personas a tomar acci\\u00f3n, porque 10.000 es el n\\u00famero de personas que se requiere para elegir o destituir a nuestr@s oficiales locales. Con 10.000 personas, podemos crear una nueva y poderosa mayor\\u00eda en Durham. 10.000 personas nos dar\\u00e1n un mandato para lograr un cambio.

Cuando esta nueva mayor\\u00eda se une en las urnas electorales y en las calles, seremos capaces de derrotar las pol\\u00edticas de divisi\\u00f3n y codicia. Junt@s, podemos enfrentar los problemas m\\u00e1s grandes\\u2014la necesidad de vivienda econ\\u00f3mica, educaci\\u00f3n de calidad, trabajos dignos, y verdadera seguridad. Junt@s, elegiremos a personas que usar\\u00e1n los impuestos que pagamos para cumplir con las necesidades b\\u00e1sicas de tod@s y luchar por un Durham donde tod@s puedan prosperar. Junt@s, exigiremos a que nuestr@s representantes locales, estatales y federales sirvan todos nuestros intereses, y no solamente los de l@s ric@s y poderos@s.

NUESTROS PRINCIPIOS

Nuestro movimiento est\\u00e1 guiado por nuestras profundas creencias y una visi\\u00f3n del futuro que estamos construyendo junt@s:

VIVIENDA PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos el derecho de vivir en un hogar seguro y econ\\u00f3mico a su alcance. Hoy en d\\u00eda en Durham, la vivienda digna es un privilegio para l@s ric@s en vez de ser un derecho de tod@s. Sabemos que la renta es demasiada alta y que l@s propietarios tienen demasiado poder sobre nuestras vidas. Sabemos que muchas personas\\u2014especialmente la gente negra y latina, personas de bajos ingresos y con discapacidades - est\\u00e1n siendo expulsadas de sus casas y desplazadas de sus propios vecindarios, lo cual hace dif\\u00edcil formar comunidades fuertes y una vida estable. Exigimos pol\\u00edticas que apoyan la vivienda econ\\u00f3mica permanente, al igual que alimentos, energ\\u00eda sustentable, agua limpia e internet al alcance de tod@s.

EDUCACI\\u00d3N PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos derecho a una educaci\\u00f3n p\\u00fablica de alta calidad que nos desarrolle integralmente. Esto incluye a l@s ni\\u00f1@s pobres, de color, inmigrantes y refugiad@s y ni\\u00f1@s con discapacidades. Sin embargo, en realidad nuestras escuelas p\\u00fablicas siguen siendo segregadas y altamente desiguales. Cada vez m\\u00e1s, la educaci\\u00f3n se centra en las calificaciones en los ex\\u00e1menes en vez del crecimiento de nuestr@s ni\\u00f1@s. Nuestras escuelas no cuentan con los recursos necesarios, y l@s que sufren son nuestr@s ni\\u00f1@s. Nos oponemos a la cancelaci\\u00f3n de programas de arte, educaci\\u00f3n f\\u00edsica, recreo y servicios para ni\\u00f1@s con necesidades especiales. Exigimos escuelas p\\u00fablicas bien financiadas que educan a las personas de manera integral desde la edad preescolar hasta la universidad/escuela profesional, y que ayudan a l@s ni\\u00f1@s a convertirse en adultos felices, saludables y pr\\u00f3sper@s.

ECONOM\\u00cdA PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos derecho a los recursos necesarios para sostenerse a si mism@ y a sus familias, y el derecho a vivir en un planeta saludable. Las grandes corporaciones lucran mucho en Durham, pero muchas de las mismas mantienen a sus trabajador@s en empleos con salarios de miseria, da\\u00f1an al medio ambiente y no pagan los impuestos que deben. Nuestr@s abuel@s, las personas con descapacidades, y personas con antecedentes penales son frecuentemente olvidad@s en nuestra econom\\u00eda. Necesitamos mayor aceso a los empleos saludables, sustentables, y de salario digno, con buenas prestaciones, para que nuestra comunidad pueda prosperar. Queremos pol\\u00edticas que reparten nuestra riqueza de manera m\\u00e1s equitativa, elevando los salarios, creando oportunidades de empleo, y manteniendo nuestros recursos dentro de nuestra comunidad. Queremos el derecho de organizar sindicatos y luchar en conjunto por la dignidad y la seguridad en el trabajo.

SANTUARIO PARA TOD@S

Tod@s tenemos el derecho de sentir segur@s en nuestros cuerpos, casas y comunidades. Demasiadas personas en Durham viven con el miedo de violencia de parte de la polic\\u00eda. Demasiadas personas viven con miedo de las leyes y oficiales que fomentan el odio y la discriminaci\\u00f3n. Demasiadas personas viven con miedo de la violencia en sus hogares o sus vecindarios. Queremos un fin a la violencia policial, al monitoreo de l@s musulmanes, las redadas de ICE y a las pol\\u00edticas que lastiman a las mujeres y las personas LGBTQ. Exigimos pol\\u00edticas que promuevan una verdadera seguridad comunitaria al acabar con la criminalizaci\\u00f3n y el encarcelamiento masivo para invertir en los empleos, la vivienda, cuidado m\\u00e9dico, educaci\\u00f3n y soluciones para una justicia basada en las comunidades y m\\u00e1s all\\u00e1 del sistema de polic\\u00eda y de c\\u00e1rceles.

DEMOCRACIA PARA TOD@S

Durham nos pertenece a todas las personas que vivimos aqu\\u00ed: nacidas aqu\\u00ed, refugiadas y migrantes, negras, latinas, musulmanes, blancas y jud\\u00edas, con o sin documentos y LGBTQ. Necesitamos todas estas voces para crear un Durham para Tod@s. Oficiales de derecha en Carolina del Norte han usado la represi\\u00f3n de votantes para limitar las voces que cuentan, han convertido el odio en la ley, y han promulgado pol\\u00edticas que solamente favorecen a l@s ric@s. Tenemos que poner fin a este ataque contra el pueblo de Carolina del Norte, y Durham tiene que estar en la vanguardia de una revoluci\\u00f3n por una democracia verdadera en nuestro estado.

NUESTRO PLAN

El poder viene de miles de personas que alzan su voz y que deciden tomar acci\\u00f3n. Por eso, nuestro plan se basa en la construcci\\u00f3n del poder popular desde las bases. El plan tiene 3 etapas:

Etapa 1: Construir un Mandato (2017). Vamos a capacitar a m\\u00e1s de 100 personas que van a pedir a sus familias, amig@s, vecin@s y colegas a que se unan a nuestro movimiento por un Durham para Tod@s. Nuestra meta es de conseguir 10.000 firmantes. Estas firmas representar\\u00e1n un mandato por una nueva visi\\u00f3n pol\\u00edtica de una ciudad arraigada en los principios de un Durham para Tod@s. Vamos a usar estos mismos principios para elegir una mayor\\u00eda progresista en el Concejo Municipal de Durham y hacer que rinda cuentas.

Etapa 2: Construir el Modelo (2018). En la segunda etapa, vamos a involucrar a l@s residentes de Durham en foros pol\\u00edticos. Nuestra meta es de profundizar m\\u00e1s sobre cada tema y crear un pliego de demandas pol\\u00edticas. Vamos a organizar una serie de reuniones de vecindario, asambleas populares, manifestaciones y otros eventos para conseguir apoyo para nuestra plataforma y para llevar nuestras demandas a las calles. Tambi\\u00e9n vamos a formar a nuev@s l\\u00edderes para expandir nuestro movimiento. Nos enfocaremos en aquell@s l\\u00edderes que son personas de clase obrera, personas de color y mujeres.

Etapa 3: Construir un Movimiento (2019-2020). En la tercera etapa, vamos a promulgar las pol\\u00edticas incluidas en la plataforma. Tambi\\u00e9n vamos a traer nuevas ideas, l\\u00edderes bien formad@s y miles de votantes a las elecciones estatales y federales tan cr\\u00edticos del 2020. Al colaborar con grupos en zonas rurales, pueblitos y otras sociedades, seremos parte de una ola de millones de residentes y l\\u00edderes dedicad@s al movimiento para recuperar la democracia en Carolina del Norte.

{"pk": 5, "path": "000100010002", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Vision and Mission", "draft_title": "Vision and Mission", "slug": "vision_and_mission", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/vision_and_mission/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": true, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:01:21.518Z", "last_published_at": "2017-10-16T03:41:04.476Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2017-10-16T03:41:04.405Z", "live_revision": 18, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "Vision and Mission", "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph\", \"value\": \"

2016 LAUNCH YEAR VISION

Our\\u00a0vision\\u00a0is of a\\u00a0Durham For All!

  • an alternative economic development model for how Durham is run, in contrast to self-interested developers and corporations
  • a practice of participatory democracy that demands equity and confronts two separate, unequal Durhams which only serve a privileged few


We envision a Durham that:

  • grows through inclusion
  • confronts disparity and demands equity
  • governs based on progressive principles of racial, economic, and environmental justice
  • is rooted in working class people of color communities
  • focuses on our local level while being grounded in a systemic analysis that responds to changing conditions at all levels
  • creates replicable city-scale projects that can impact and shift the balance of power at the state and national levels

2016 LAUNCH YEAR MISSION

Durham For All's mission is to develop and maintain a political vehicle rooted in and led by working class people of color that builds political power to win. To accomplish this, we will:

  • use neighborhood, place-based organizing
  • engage in both electoral politics and issue-based campaigns
  • explore solidarity economies, people's assemblies, and creative engagement
  • develop and implement a broad progressive agenda, vision, and narrative for how Durham should be organized, in opposition to corporate & development power
  • unite and cohere an array of multi-racial, progressive political forces in Durham so that we can collectively win!
\", \"id\": \"04e31a75-7928-401f-9434-6bf37269dcff\"}]"}

{"pk": 6, "path": "000100010003", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Who We Are", "draft_title": "Who We Are", "slug": "who_we_are", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/who_we_are/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": true, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:03:07.534Z", "last_published_at": "2017-10-16T03:41:35.817Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2017-10-16T03:41:35.763Z", "live_revision": 19, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "Who We Are", "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph\", \"value\": \"

Durham For All launched in early 2016, but before then our founding team engaged in different issue-based organizing across Durham over the years. In 2014 and 2015, members of our founding team began experimenting with building political power through local elections, and we helped win young, progressive, people of color into local offices.

Durham For All is made up of a four-person Coordinating Team to bottom-line daily operations and a larger Campaign Team that is leading our\\u00a010K Strong Campaign! Our core leadership is primary people of color, and our entire team is a multiracial, cross-class alliance of Durham organizers and activists with a range of skill-sets and progressive movement experience.

Durham For All is an independent political organization, and a 501(c)(4).

\", \"id\": \"2d507b8b-b30a-4c77-b986-f692f545a91f\"}]"}

{"pk": 7, "path": "000100010004", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "2016 Efforts", "draft_title": "2016 Efforts", "slug": "2016_efforts", "content_type": 7, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/2016_efforts/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": true, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2017-09-12T04:03:58.143Z", "last_published_at": "2017-10-16T03:42:01.386Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2017-10-16T03:42:01.334Z", "live_revision": 20, "date": "2017-09-11", "intro": "2016 Efforts", "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph\", \"value\": \"

NEIGHBORHOOD STABILIZATION ADVOCACY CAMPAIGN

(Early-Mid 2016)

As a result of the recent home revaluations, the average increase in home property values across Durham County is around 12%. But in Black & Brown working class neighborhoods that are rapidly gentrifying, there is a potential for property taxes to double or more than triple by 2017. In order to shift resources to working class residents, Durham For All:

  • Knocked on hundreds of doors to educate Northeast Central Durham (NECD) residents on the impact of the Property Tax Revaluation and availability of existing tax relief resources for homeowners
  • Worked with residents and city officials to advocate for a revamp of Durham's minor home repairs program as a way to provide tax relief for homeowners and to protect the cost of housing for renters

BASE BUILDING & RELATIONSHIP BUILDING

(Mid-Late 2016)

In the summer, Durham For All formed a team to lead base building in Durham's Precinct 14 in NECD. We have:

  • Continued to knock on hundreds of more doors, talking with folks in English and Spanish to learn about the issues they care about most, share our vision of political power, and invite them to get involved
  • Connected with leaders and groups in NECD
  • Held various community conversations about political power building with community members
  • Hosted a September Block Party next to East Durham Park, where hundreds came out to party and learn about Durham For All
  • Partnered with\\u00a0BYP 100 Durham\\u00a0in late October to lead a March to the Polls event from East Durham Park
  • Participated in the first Assembly of Latino Organizations in NC with Latin@ community members we met through door knocking

LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT

Throughout 2016, we are investing deeply in leadership development by:

  • expanding our team and participating in a collective study & practice process with new members
  • sending some of our team to a two-part, 8-day leadership course called\\u00a0Transformation in Action by Generative Somatics\\u00a0and a three-day alternative economies conference in Buffalo, New York, called\\u00a0CommonBound
  • building the leadership of Black & Brown residents in working class neighborhoods through trainings and shared practice in:
    • door knocking
    • event mobilization
    • public speaking
    • relationship building, and more!
\", \"id\": \"0abdd79c-95e6-47d5-a1f6-395031632010\"}]"}
